item.title: UK motorist jailed for 10 years for killing pedestrian in high-speed crash
item.description:
Ali Xhaferri was driving at between 70mph and 92 mph in a 40mph zone in north London when he killed Ahmed Moneer

A motorist has been jailed for 10 years after killing a pedestrian and seriously injuring his passenger after driving at up to 92mph (148kph) on a north London road.

Ali Xhaferri, 43, lost control of his BMW on the A406 North Circular Road at Stonebridge on 11 March 2022 and struck Ahmed Moneer, 37, a pedestrian who was walking along the pavement.

Continue reading...
